definition: Frederic Chopin or Fryderyk Franciszek Chopin (1810-1849), Polish pianist and composer

sentences.english: The concert closed with a nocturne by Chopin.
sentences.chinese: 會議以肖邦的夜曲結束。

sentences.english: B: I don't have one single favorite, but these days I listen to a lot of Chopin.
sentences.chinese: 我沒有最喜歡的一個，但最近我聽了不少肖邦。

sentences.english: Even if still aesthetic, Chopin, also flicks sadness not producing me.
sentences.chinese: 即使再唯美的肖邦，也彈不出我的悲傷。

sentences.english: In Nocturne, the Chopin put his entire heart open.
sentences.chinese: 在夜曲中，肖邦把他的整個心靈都打開了。

sentences.english: Chopin Mazurkas, op. 33, no. 2, Piano Fou Ts'ong.
sentences.chinese: 肖邦瑪祖卡，作品33號第2首，鋼琴傅聰。

sentences.english: It was in this room that Chopin gave the first performances of this concerto.
sentences.chinese: 就是在這個房間裏，肖邦首次演奏該協奏曲。

sentences.english: The pianist concluded the recital with a Chopin Etude .
sentences.chinese: 這位鋼琴家以一部肖邦練習曲結束了獨奏會。

sentences.english: The nocturne, written by Chopin, can change people's feelings.
sentences.chinese: 肖邦的《夜曲》是一部能夠移情的作品。

sentences.english: Some of Mozart and Beethoven's early works, Chopin, Liszt.
sentences.chinese: 莫扎特和貝多芬的早期作品，肖邦，李斯特。

sentences.english: Li Yundi took part in the 14th Chopin International Piano Competition in Polan.
sentences.chinese: 李雲迪在波蘭參加了第14屆肖邦國際鋼琴比賽。

sentences.english: Poland also organized wonderful events in China marking the bicentenary of Frederic Chopin.
sentences.chinese: 波在華成功舉辦肖邦誕辰200週年活動。

sentences.english: The second part of the paper is the musicology analysis of the third banters tune of Chopin.
sentences.chinese: 論文的第二部分是對於肖邦第三諧謔曲的音樂學分析。

sentences.english: I heard him practising Chopin's first ballade.
sentences.chinese: 我聽到過他練習肖邦第一協奏曲。

sentences.english: But it is Chopin's nocturnes that will be forever synonymous with his name.
sentences.chinese: 然而肖邦的夜曲纔是他永遠的代名詞。

sentences.english: Chopin is a musician of milestone type in tbe history of piano.
sentences.chinese: 肖邦在世界鋼琴史上是一位里程碑式的音樂家。

sentences.english: The composer has arranged Chopin's nocturnes for the full orchestra.
sentences.chinese: 這位作曲家已將肖邦的小夜曲改編爲合奏曲。

definition: Antonin Dvořák (1841-1904), Bohemian composer, author of nine symphonies including the New World symphony
Niccolò Paganini (1782-1840), Italian violinist and composer
Hector Berlioz (1803-1869), French romantic composer, author of Symphonie Fantastique
Alexander Scriabin (1872-1915), Russian composer and pianist
Piotr Ilyich Tchaikowsky (1840-1893), Russian composer, composer of 6 symphonies and the opera Eugene Onegin
